track.name: Algorithms
track.descriptions: The true test of problem solving: when one realizes that time and memory aren't infinite.

primary_contest.description:
Join our biggest contest, Week of Code 29! This is a 7 day contest beginning Monday, February 20th at 12:00am PDT. 

Each day, we’ll unlock a new challenge for you to solve. The top 10 hackers win exclusive HackerRank T-shirts. Sign up now and we’ll send you a quick reminder each day to keep you on track. See you on the leaderboard!
primary_contest.name: Week of Code 29

model.python3_template:
#!/bin/python3

import sys


w,h = input().strip().split(' ')
w,h = [int(w),int(h)]
circleX,circleY,r = input().strip().split(' ')
circleX,circleY,r = [int(circleX),int(circleY),int(r)]
x1,y1,x3,y3 = input().strip().split(' ')
x1,y1,x3,y3 = [int(x1),int(y1),int(x3),int(y3)]
# your code goes here
model.name: A Circle and a Square

model.python_template:
#!/bin/python

import sys


w,h = raw_input().strip().split(' ')
w,h = [int(w),int(h)]
circleX,circleY,r = raw_input().strip().split(' ')
circleX,circleY,r = [int(circleX),int(circleY),int(r)]
x1,y1,x3,y3 = raw_input().strip().split(' ')
x1,y1,x3,y3 = [int(x1),int(y1),int(x3),int(y3)]

model.ruby_template:
#!/bin/ruby

w,h = gets.strip.split(' ')
w = w.to_i
h = h.to_i
circleX,circleY,r = gets.strip.split(' ')
circleX = circleX.to_i
circleY = circleY.to_i
r = r.to_i
x1,y1,x3,y3 = gets.strip.split(' ')
x1 = x1.to_i
y1 = y1.to_i
x3 = x3.to_i
y3 = y3.to_i
# your code goes here
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    w_temp <- getLine
    let w_t = words w_temp
    let w = read $ w_t!!0 :: Int
    let h = read $ w_t!!1 :: Int
    circlex_temp <- getLine
    let circlex_t = words circlex_temp
    let circlex = read $ circlex_t!!0 :: Int
    let circley = read $ circlex_t!!1 :: Int
    let r = read $ circlex_t!!2 :: Int
    x1_temp <- getLine
    let x1_t = words x1_temp
    let x1 = read $ x1_t!!0 :: Int
    let y1 = read $ x1_t!!1 :: Int
    let x3 = read $ x1_t!!2 :: Int
    let y3 = read $ x1_t!!3 :: Int
    -- your code goes here

getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: Draw a circle and a square at specific coordinates within a raster image.
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
        let [
          w_temp (read-line) 
          w_t (split w_temp #"\s+") 
          w (Integer/parseInt (w_t 0)) 
          h (Integer/parseInt (w_t 1)) 
        ]

      (
        let [
          circleX_temp (read-line) 
          circleX_t (split circleX_temp #"\s+") 
          circleX (Integer/parseInt (circleX_t 0)) 
          circleY (Integer/parseInt (circleX_t 1)) 
          r (Integer/parseInt (circleX_t 2)) 
        ]
      )

      (
        let [
          x1_temp (read-line) 
          x1_t (split x1_temp #"\s+") 
          x1 (Integer/parseInt (x1_t 0)) 
          y1 (Integer/parseInt (x1_t 1)) 
          x3 (Integer/parseInt (x1_t 2)) 
          y3 (Integer/parseInt (x1_t 3)) 
        ]
      )

    ; your code goes here
)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [W,H]} = io:fread("", "~d~d"),
    { ok, [Circlex,Circley,R]} = io:fread("", "~d~d~d"),
    { ok, [X1,Y1,X3,Y3]} = io:fread("", "~d~d~d~d"),
    % your code goes here
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
